Name: Model obelisk
Description: This model obelisk is a miniature version of the obelisk of Sethos I and Ramesses II from the sun temple of Heliopolis. The original, of pink granite, is 23.20 metres tall. It was the first obelisk to be shipped to Rome in 10 AD and was re-erected in the Circus Maximus. In 1589 it was erected for a third time in the Piazza del Popolo, after a period in which it had been lost.This copy was not done from the original but from drawings by Athanasius Kircher (1652), presumably in the 17th century.
